gobblin.writer.http

Class AbstractHttpWriter<D>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.instrumented.writer.InstrumentedDataWriter<D>
      • gobblin.writer.http.AbstractHttpWriter<D>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Instrumentable, FinalState, DataWriter<D>, HttpWriterDecoration<D>, Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HttpWriter

    public abstract class AbstractHttpWriter<D>
extends InstrumentedDataWriter<D>
implements HttpWriterDecoration<D>
    Base class for HTTP writers. Defines the main extension points for different implementations.

      • writeImpl

        public void writeImpl(D record)
               throws IOException
        Send and process the request. If it's a retry request, skip onNewRecord method call and go straight sending request.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws IOException
        Prior to commit, it will invoke flush method to flush any remaining item if writer uses batch
        Specified by:
        commit in interface DataWriter<D>
        Overrides:
        commit in class InstrumentedDataWriter<D>
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        InstrumentedDataWriterBase.commit()

      • flush

        public void flush()
        If writer supports batch, override this method. (Be aware of failure and retry as flush can be called multiple times in case of failure @see SalesforceRestWriter )

      • sendRequest

        public ListenableFuture<org.apache.http.client.methods.CloseableHttpResponse> sendRequest(org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpUriRequest request)
                                                                                   throws IOException
        Sends request using single thread pool so that it can be easily terminated(use case: time out) An extension point to send the actual request to the remote server.
        Specified by:
        sendRequest in interface HttpWriterDecoration<D>
        Parameters:
        request - the request to be sent
        Returns:
        a future that allows access to the response. Response may be retrieved synchronously or asynchronously.
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        HttpWriterDecoration.sendRequest(org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpUriRequest)

      • isRetry

        public boolean isRetry()
        Checks if it's retry request. All successful request should make currentRequest absent. If currentRequest still exists, it means there was a failure. There's couple of methods need this indicator such as onNewRecord, since it is not a new record.
        Returns:
        true if current request it holds is retry.

      • waitForResponse

        public org.apache.http.client.methods.CloseableHttpResponse waitForResponse(ListenableFuture<org.apache.http.client.methods.CloseableHttpResponse> responseFuture)
        Default implementation is to use HttpClients socket timeout which is waiting based on elapsed time between last packet sent from client till receive it from server. Customize the waiting for an HTTP response. Can add timeout logic.
        Specified by:
        waitForResponse in interface HttpWriterDecoration<D>
        Parameters:
        responseFuture - the future object of the last sent request
        See Also:
        HttpWriterDecoration.waitForResponse(com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture)

      • processResponse

        public void processResponse(org.apache.http.client.methods.CloseableHttpResponse response)
                     throws IOException,
                            UnexpectedResponseException
        Default implementation where any status code equal to or greater than 400 is regarded as a failure. Processes the response
        Specified by:
        processResponse in interface HttpWriterDecoration<D>
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was a problem reading the response
        UnexpectedResponseException - if the response was unexpected
        See Also:
        gobblin.writer.http.HttpWriterDecoration#processResponse(org.apache.http.HttpResponse)
